reasoning: X-linked Alport syndrome is the most common form (~85% of cases), with overall Alport syndrome prevalence ~1.3 per 100k. Incidence of new diagnoses estimated ~2.5 per 100k person-years based on pediatric nephrology literature; prevalence ~20 per 100k for living cases.
source: Kashtan CE et al. (2003). Alport syndrome and thin basement membrane disease. Adv Chronic Kidney Dis. 10(1):24-32
